meanings.definition: A genre of crime film or fiction characterized by cynicism, fatalism, and moral ambiguity.
meanings.sent1: I watched a noir movie last night, and it had a lot of suspense and mystery.
meanings.sent2: The detective in the noir novel was always solving complex cases with unexpected twists.
meanings.sent3: Why did the noir film director always choose rainy nights for the scenes?
meanings.sent4: The noir story painted a dark picture of the city, where danger lurked in every shadow.
meanings.sent5: The noir genre captures the gritty reality of crime and corruption in a compelling way.

meanings.sent1: Her dress was a deep noir that matched the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The artist used noir tones to create a sense of mystery and drama in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The noir paint on the walls made the room feel cozy and intimate.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered, turning the sky into a brooding noir.
meanings.sent5: The noir shade of the curtains blocked out all the light, creating a somber atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A type of grape used in winemaking, especially in the production of red wine.
meanings.sent1: The winery harvested the noir grapes to make their signature red wine.
meanings.sent2: The sommelier recommended a glass of pinot noir to pair with the steak.
meanings.sent3: The noir vineyard was known for producing rich and flavorful wines.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the noir wine filled the room with hints of berries and spices.
meanings.sent5: The noir grape added a velvety texture and a hint of oak to the wine blend.
